detail-type.description: An identifier for the system or application to identify the event type.

source.description: An identifier for the system or application to identify the event type.

PublisherID.description: An identifier for the system or application that last published or updated a record.

AddressLine1.description: Supporter's Address line 1 If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

AddressLine2.description: Supporter's Address line 2 If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

AddressLine3.description: Supporter's Address line 3 If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

AddressLine4.description: Supporter's Address line 4 If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

AddressSourceId.description: It is a tech field used to uniquely identify each contact information in the CRM. If there is no unique Address Id in source, then integration layer will concatenate the supporterId + 'Address'. Example '12345Address' If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

AddressStatus.description: Field that indicates the type of address validation done on the source. There is a list of values to map it to the expected values in Person Hub. Leave it NULL if unknown

Country.description: Supporter's Country. There is a list of values to map the country to the expected values in Person Hub. If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.
enum: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

County.description: Supporter's County. There is a list of values to map the county to the expected values in Person Hub. If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

CreatedDate.description: Date when the supporter was created in the source system.This value is populated in the AddressCreatedDate,EmailCreatedDate, LandlineCreatedDate or MobileCreatedDate fields when an address or contact information exists.

DoNotContact.description: Flag that indicates if the supporter wants to be contacted by CRUK or not. Leave it NULL if unknown

EmailSourceId.description: It is a tech field used to uniquely identify each contact information in the CRM. If there is no unique Email Id in source, then integration layer will concatenate the supporterId + 'Email'. Example '12345Email'

Gender.description: Supporter's Gender. There is a list of values to map the gender to the expected values in PersonHub

GuestIndicator.description: This flag is used to indicate that the incoming record either has no persistent ID or is using a shared ID e.g. a shared guest ID for users not logged into a website, a manual spreadsheet load without IDs. When the flag is set to true, this data will be given a one time use ID and be sent to Semarchy for matching (if not also anonymous). This data will never receive updates from this source as the ID was not persistent. When the flag is set to false, this indicates that the source sending the data will persist the ID for the same person over time, therefore updates could be received for this ID and should update the relevant person in Semarchy and downstream.  - IF GuestIndicator = true and IsAnonymousAtSource = true then the supporter will skip Semarchy and be loaded to the CRM with Anon URN  - IF GuestIndicator = true and IsAnonymousAtSource = false then the supporter will be loaded to Semarchy and use Semarchy to match the Goldern URN.  - IF GuestIndicator = false and IsAnonymousAtSource = true then the supporter will be loaded to Semarchy and set IsAnonymousAtSource = true  - IF GuestIndicator = false and IsAnonymousAtSource = false then the supporter will be loaded to Semarchy and use Semarchy to match the Goldern URN' More info here

IsAddressInvalid.description: Flag that indicates if the source has validated the address of the supporter. Leave it NULL if unknown

IsAnonymous.description: Flag that indicates if the supporter wants to be treated as anonymous, even if we know who they are but has indicated to not be contacted by CRUK in the permissions. This flag is not used to exclude supporters from processing in the transaction or supporters pipeline. This field is used to map into the Siebel Supporter StatusCode field.

IsAnonymousAtSource.description: Flag that indicates if the source system has sent anonymous data for the supporter. The difference with the 'IsAnonymous' field is that in some cases we can receive the supporter data but they don't want to be contacted by CRUK (so IsAnonymous = true) and in other cases we just received everything as 'anonymous' or null (isAnonymousAtSource=true) More info here

IsDeceased.description: Flag that indicates if the supporter is deceased (true), or not (false). Send it NULL if unknown

IsEmailInvalid.description: Flag that indicates if the email address has been validated at source. Leave it NULL if unknown

IsGoneAway.description: Flag that indicates if the supporter has moved houses. Leave it NULL if unknown

IsHighValueSupporter.description: Flag that indicates if the supporter corresponds to a HighValue supporter. Leave it NULL if unknown

IsLandlineInvalid.description: Flag that indicates if the landline number has been validated at source. Leave it NULL if unknown

IsOrganisation.description: Flag that indicates if the supporter is an organisation. Leave it NULL if unknown

LandlineSourceId.description: It is a tech field used to uniquely identify each contact information in the CRM. If there is no unique Landline Id in source, then integration layer will concatenate the supporterId + 'Landline'. Example '12345Landline'

MobileSourceId.description: It is a tech field used to uniquely identify each contact information in the CRM. If there is no unique Mobile Id in source, then integration layer will concatenate the supporterId + 'Mobile'. Example '12345Mobile'

NonTaxPayerIndicator.description: If the supporter has indicated that they do not pay tax

NonTaxPayerUpdateDate.description: A timestamp in yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss format corresponding to the point in time when NoTaxPayerIndicator has been updated.

PermissionCapturedDate.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the date when a permission value was captured for a specific permission type. Cannot be a future date, default to batch date if in the future.

PermissionEndDate.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the last date a permission value was valid for a specific permission type

PermissionValue.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the value provided by the supporter for a specific permission type. There is a list of values to use to map the correct value with the expected one in PersonHub.

PermissionSource.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the source system where the permission was provided. There is a list of values to use to map the correct value with the expected one in PersonHub.

PermissionSourceId.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is a tech field used to uniquely identify each contact information in the CRM. It needs to be unique for each of the permissions of a supporter, and be different each time the same supporter is received. If there is no unique specific permission Id in source then assign a unique identifier, unique per supporter and type of permission

PermissionSourceDetail.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the source code linked to the event the supporter is fundraising or donating too.  Value must be UPPERCASE

PermissionType.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the type of permission provided. There is a list of values to use to map the correct value with the expected one in PersonHub.

PermissionRecordType.description: Permissions are grouped by permission type. Only the information of a provided permission type must be sent. This is the type of permission record provided. There is a list of values to use to map the correct value with the expected one in PersonHub.

PermissionConsentStatement.description: Statement displayed to the supporter around handling and permission policy when interacting with a third party

PermissionPrivacyNoticeVersion.description: Version of the statemnt displayed to the supporter when interacting with a third party

Prefix.description: Supporter's Prefix. There is a list of values to map the prefix to the expected values in Person Hub.

RMMerchandiseType.description: Merchandise reference information for retail purchases

RMEventCode.description: This is the unique identifier for a specific event or activity that supporters can participate in for fundraising.

RMCampaignCode.description: This is the unique identifier used for a specific Marketing Campaign

SentDate.description: Date when the supporter was sent in the source system.This value is populated in the AddressSentDate,EmailSentDate, LandlineSentDate or MobileSentDate fields when an address or contact information exists.

SourceCode.description: Source code related to the supporter activity. If the supporter is a fundraiser, then this is the source code of the event they are fundraising against. In case of a donor, then this is the source code of the event he is donating to.  Value must be in UPPERCASE

SupporterSourceId.description: Unique identifier assigned to each supporter at source. It needs to be unique per supporter when pushing it to PersonHub so it can identify the supporters correctly. If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

Title.description: Supporter's Title. There is a list of values to map the title to the expected values in Person Hub.

Town.description: Supporter's Town If this field, or any of the following fields, is not null or empty, an address record will be created: AddressLine1, Country, County, PostCode, Town, SupporterSourceId, AddressSourceId.

UpdatedDate.description: Date when the supporter was updated in the source system.This value is populated in the AddressUpdatedDate,EmailUpdatedDate, LandlineUpdatedDate or MobileUpdatedDate fields when an address or contact information exists.

WebsiteSourceId.description: It is a tech field used to uniquely identify each contact information in the CRM. If there is no unique Website Id in source, then integration layer will concatenate the supporterId + 'Website'. Example '12345Website'

ActivityDate.description: This field represent the actual date of performing the activity by supporter (or organisation) for Fundraising Activities type of Events. This value will be NULL for other types of Events.

AttendedStatus.description: The field indicates whether the supporter/organisation actually attended the event. Confirms presence vs no-show for reporting, stewardship insight and follow-up communication.

CancerType.description: The cancer type for the Event Registration, this can include values such as 'Better Treatment' and 'Cancer Research UK's work', as well as Cancer Types such as Bowel.

Channel.description: The channel of response for Event Registration Communication History. Possible dependency on Event Registration Staging Id and other Communication History values.

DataSource.description: Attribute is used to indicate the source of the upstream data source. Not visible on Siebel UI.

EmergencyContactName.description: String field containing person's emergency contact for the specific event, can be left null.

EmergencyContactNumber.description: Can be null even if an emergency contact name is given, can also be populated if emergency contact name is null. Can contain up to 40 characters, including the '+' symbol.

EntryFeeStatus.description: The fee status for the participation entry, e.g Free of Charge, Paid in Full.

EntryType.description: The type of participation entry, e.g. Individual.

EventCode.description: Event Code for Event Registration, must not be null and must be an existing event code from the event master list on Siebel.

FulfilmentNote.description: The fulfillment note for the communication history. Can be null if Event Resigration Source is also null. Cannot be null if Event Resigration Source is populated. Can contain any string value and will not fail, but will not load to Siebel UI unless its a recognised value and dependant fields are populated.

FulfilmentStatus.description: Describe whether the pack or materials were sent. This field is not yet populated by any process but will be needed in the future state. LOVs to be determined.Required for Salesforce.

FundraisingPageId.description: Identifier of the fundraising page assigned to the event registration in the source system.  Siebel will accept any string value without the job failing, but this field has a dependency on EventRegistration.FundraisingPageType to be populated to populate Siebel UI with data values.

FundraisingPageType.description: Type of the fundraising page received from source, indicates where the page was created. There is a list of values to use to map the correct value.

FundraisingPageURL.description: URL of the fundraising page. Siebel will accept any string value without the job failing, but this field has a dependency on Event Registration.Fundraising Page Type to be populated to populate Siebel UI with data values.

FundraisingTarget.description: Target for the fundraising individual to raise

GroupName.description: When participating as a group, this will be the name of that group. Will accept any string or can be left null.

GroupRole.description: Role of a member in a group, note this can be null even when Group Name is populated. LOV includes Individual, Organiser and Group Member.

HowHeardAbout.description: Picklist of options for how the event was heard about, can be left null.

InviteSource.description: Refers to the source of the invite, this could be Mass, Volunteering, Retail, Friends, etc.

Motivation.description: The motivation for event participation, from picklist values.
enum: Part of a group taking part
To take part in a fun event

OldRegistrationNumber.description: Cannot be random string field, sometimes looks to be the Reg Number of a former event that is cancelled

OwnerType.description: This field is to indicate if the source sends Organisations or Individual supporters data. If the source clearly identifies the type then they will send 'Organisation' for organisations supporters, 'Supporter' for individual supporters. If the source cannot identify the type then they will send NULL.

ParticipationType.description: The Participation Type for the Individuals Event Registration, e.g. Speaker, Sponsor, Participant.

PlaceType.description: If populated, value must be from current picklist on Siebel, which includes values: Own Place, Non Fundraising Participant, Guaranteed Place, Flexi Funder

PledgeAmount.description: Amount pledged to raise for event participation. Accepts positive and negative numbers, with decimal places but Sievel UI will round to 2dp

RegistrationNumber.description: Event registration number, can be a combination of alpha-numeric characters, and include characters such as '-'.

RegistrationStatus.description: Status of an individuals event registration, e.g. Confirmed, Cancelled, Awaiting 3rd Party. Must be populated from Siebel's LOV.

RunningNumber.description: Participants running number for the event. Decimal places can be input, but will not appear on UI. Whole Int should be requested from source.

Source.description: The source for Communication History. Must be the same as Event Code or null.

StagingId.description: Not visible on Siebel UI, suspected role is linking between details parsed in Event Registration entity which appear across the Event Registration and Communication History applet in Siebel.

SupporterRegistrationType.description: Registration type of the Supporter for the Event. Not present on Siebel UI.

SurvivorshipActivities.description: A true / false indication of whether event participation is a survivorship activity.

TShirtSize.description: Size for the tshirt for fulfilment

ParentEventRegistrationId.description: Holds the registration ID of the primary participant on the booking. Will be equal to the registration ID if the registration is a primary participant.

IsGroupRegistrar.description: Will be true if the registration is of the primary participant, false otherwise.
